results.title: The Black stallion
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, United Artists Corporation, Omni Zoetrope and Carroll Ballard
results.brief_description: A young boy is saved from a devastating shipwreck by a beautiful black stallion. Together they survive on an isolated island, an experience that creates a lasting bond between them. After their rescue, they return to America where they meet Henry Dailey (Mickey Rooney) an irascible ex-jockey and horse trainer. Dailey is quick to realise the racing potential of the stallion and teaches the boy to be a jockey. Based on the novel by Walter Farley the film stars Kelly Reno, Mickey Reno and Teri Garr.

results.title: The Black pirate. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited and narrated presentation of the duels, sea battles and acrobatics in the ‘Black Pirate’ an adventure film made in 1926 starring Douglas Fairbanks. Includes the famous sliding-down-the-sail stunt. Also stars Billie Dove.

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: The Black man and his bride
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: By using camera movement and editing technique the film animates the series of paintings “The Black Man and his Bride”, by Arthur Boyd, which tells the story of an aborigine and his half-caste bride. Tim Burstall also wrote the original ballad sung to guitar accompaniment which runs for the duration of the film sung by Donald Ayrton.

results.title: The Black lake
results.creator_credit: British Foundation Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: The famous asphalt lake in Trinidad is the scene of one of the island’s major industries. The film shows how the raw material is dug, processed, packed and shipped to many parts of the world. Trinidad asphalt is used for floors, roofs, electrical insulation and roads. Roads surfaced by Trinidad Lake asphalt are found the world over. The film includes a full account of operations at the asphalt refinery converting the raw material from the lake into the finished product ready for export.

results.title: The Black death, 1361
results.creator_credit: Leo Eaton, Altug Savasal, Diane Holmes and Maryland Public Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Timeline”.
A dramatic recreation of the social upheaval experienced in the Middle Ages due to the spread of the Black Death. Modelled on a news broadcast, the program looks at the causes and impact of the Plague, and “interviews” key historical figures of the time. At its most virulent, the disease decimated both city and rural populations and created severe labour shortages.

results.title: The Black chain
results.creator_credit: Michael Sklar, Carousel Films, CBS Television Network and Joseph Krumgold
results.brief_description: Significant achievements in streptococcus research and the potential cure of rheumatic heart disease. Filmed at the Alfred I. Du Pont Institute in Wilmington, Delaware, showing the work of Dr Arnine T. Wilson. Microphotography shows the actions of white and red blood cells and the virulent form of streptococcus (Black chain) and the defence of one against the other.

results.title: The Black cat
results.creator_credit: Carl Laemmle Jnr, Universal Pictures and Edgar G. Ulmer
results.brief_description: Honeymooners Peter and Joan Allison are travelling through Eastern Europe on the Orient Express when a double-booking finds them sharing their compartment with the gracious but brooding Dr. Vitus Werdergast (Bela Lugosi). After Joan is injured when their bus crashes on a deserted road, Werdergast and the Allisons take shelter in the sepulchral home of Hjalmar Poelzig (Boris Karloff), one of Austria’s greatest architects. Werdergast has just finished tending to Joan’s injuries when the cadaverous Poelzig, swathed in severe black robes, makes an appearance. Werdergast reveals he has waited fifteen years for the chance to both find his wife Karen, and their daughter, and to kill Poelzig, whom he is convinced knows something about their disappearance. The sadistic Poelzig - who is also a High Priest heading a cult of devil-worshippers - decides to hold them all captive, and torments Werdergast by revealing the fate of his family. After Joan starts exhibiting some strange behaviour, it is up to Werdergast to try and save her from becoming the bride of Lucifer while seeking the opportunity to exact revenge on the man who destroyed his life. An atmospheric and chilling classic, featuring fine performances from Lugosi and Karloff in their respective roles. The concept of this film was very loosely suggested by the story “The Black Cat” by Edgar Allen Poe.

results.title: The Black Cannon incident
results.brief_description: This daring political comedy caused a huge controversy on release in China and was banned from export for two years. An inoffensive engineer comes under suspicion of industrial espionage when he sends a personal telegram which makes a cryptic mention of a Black Cannon. The Security Bureau finds some “worrying” data in his personal file, for example he was raised as a catholic. An investigation is launched and the resulting chaos provides the basis of a tragi-comedy narrative in which the Chinese ruling class is daringly satirised. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Black book = Reign of terror
results.creator_credit: William Cameron Menzies, JEF Films and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to the book naming the individuals the sadistic ruler of France during the Revolution, Robespierre (Richard Basehart), plans to execute by guillotine. Charles D’Aubigny (Robert Cummings), is enlisted by a group of political moderates to try and retrieve the book and expose Robespierre’s corruption. Also starring Arlene Dahl, Richard Hart, Arnold Moss and Beulah Bondi. The film is also known as “Reign of terror”.
